=== Referring to the User Interface ===

The standard methods of tagging items in user interfaces (UI) are detailed below.

==== Buttons ====

For push buttons, use the tag <code><guibutton>Button Caption</guibutton></code>. The caption should match the exact caption used by the button in the UI.

The following controls should be referred to when using the <code><guibutton></code> tag:

* Normal push buttons
  <nowiki>[[File:button.png]]</nowiki>
* Toggle buttons

==== Labels ====

For labels such as the names of text entries and tabs, use the tag <code><guilabel>Label Text</guilabel></code>. The label text should exactly match the text used in the UI, minus the trailing colon (":") if there is one.

The following controls should be referred to when using the <code><guilabel></code> tag:

=== Referring to Files and Commands ===

This section describes the tags to be used when referring to files, directories, and commands that the user inputs into the terminal.

==== Files and Directories ====

When referring to a file, use <code><filename>/path/to/file</filename></code>.

Refer to directories using <code><filename classname="directory">/path/to/directory</filename></code>.

Refer to file extensions using <code><filename classname="extension">.ext</filename></code>.

==== Terminal Commands ====

The commands themselves should be placed in <code><screen><command>ls /root</command></screen></code> if the intent is to type the command into a terminal prompt.

The tags <code><command></command></code> can also be used outside the <code><screen></screen></code> tags if appropriate.  For example, inside <code><note></note></code> tags.

'''Output''' from terminal commands should be wrapped in <code><screen></screen></code> tags as well.

==== Configuration Files and Source Code ====

Source code and configuration file examples should be placed in <code><programlisting></programlisting></code> tags.
